column4: US STOCKS SNAPSHOT-Wall St ends flat; Microsoft rallies  healthcare falls
column5: NEW YORK  Oct 21 The S&P 500 and the Dow ended little changed and the Nasdaq advanced on Friday  as a record day for Microsoft and earnings from McDonald's helped offset a fall in energy and healthcare names.

column4: EU regulators want to know if LinkedIn data is unique: sources
column5: BRUSSELS EU antitrust regulators want to know whether LinkedIn's data is unique  two people familiar with the matter said on Friday  which could be key to their decision on Microsoft's $26 billion bid for the social network.

column4: EU regulators want to know if LinkedIn data is unique - sources

column4: US STOCKS-Health  energy stocks hit Wall St  Microsoft lifts Nasdaq
column5: * Dow down 0.25 pct  S&P down 0.16 pct  Nasdaq up 0.14 pct   (Updates to afternoon)

column4: US STOCKS-S&P  Dow fall with health stocks; Microsoft lifts Nasdaq
column5: * Dow down 0.52 pct  S&P down 0.27 pct  Nasdaq up 0.06 pct   (Adds details  comments  updates prices)

column4: US STOCKS-Wall St drops on bleak GE outlook; Microsoft blunts losses
column5: * Indexes down: Dow 0.53 pct  S&P 0.45 pct  Nasdaq 0.22 pct   (Updates to open)

column4: US STOCKS SNAPSHOT-S&P  Dow open lower as GE drags; Nasdaq flat
column5: Oct 21 The S&P 500 and the Dow opened lower on Friday as GE disappointing forecast weighed on industrial stocks and the dollar rose to a seven-month high  while the Nasdaq was little changed as Microsoft rallied.

column4: Nintendo unveils new console  shares slide as features underwhelm
column5: TOKYO Nintendo Co Ltd offered a sneak preview of a new gaming system that can be used both as a traditional console as well as a handheld device  but a lack of revolutionary features helped send its shares sliding 6 percent.

column4: UPDATE 3-Nintendo unveils new console  shares slide as features underwhelm
column5: * New system doubles up as traditional console and handheld device

column4: Qualcomm nears $37 billion deal to buy NXP Semiconductors: source
column5: Qualcomm Inc is nearing a deal to acquire NXP Semiconductors NV for around $37 billion  a person familiar with the matter said on Friday  as the U.S. company seeks to expand the reach of its chips from phones to cars.

column4: UPDATE 1-Qualcomm nears $37 billion deal to buy NXP Semiconductors -source
column5: Oct 21 Qualcomm Inc is nearing a deal to acquire NXP Semiconductors NV for around $37 billion  a person familiar with the matter said on Friday  as the U.S. company seeks to expand the reach of its chips from phones to cars.
